plot: Kevin takes the twins to the cabin in hopes of proving himself as a father.

Following Rebecca's Thanksgiving Day pronouncement to the Big Three, Kevin takes her words to heart and decides to take the twins on his own to the cabin to prove himself a father, a move that almost speaks he speaks with sees as being folly and again biting off more than he can chew, especially handling the pair on his own during the travel phase. Being at the cabin also allows him to see the progress of the house construction being overseen by Cassidy and Nicky, with Matty and Edie also there. While he is in the process of learning how to play the guitar, another of those grand goals he is doing very badly, he can't help but reflect on other past goals and their failure, such as when he was six and wanted to dive off the diving board at the deep end of the pool and touch the drain at the bottom like the bigger kids even before he knew how to swim. But the events of others at the cabin gives him a broader perspective of how he believes he should fit into the lives of others for whom he truly cares.—Huggo
